refsect1.title: Object Hierarchy
refsect1.screen: GObject â°ââ GInitiallyUnowned â°ââ GstObject â°ââ GstElement â°ââ GstBin â°ââ GstRtpBin

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: RTP bin combines the functions of GstRtpSession, GstRtpSsrcDemux, GstRtpJitterBuffer and GstRtpPtDemux in one element. It allows for multiple RTP sessions that will be synchronized together using RTCP SR packets.
GstRtpBin is configured with a number of request pads that define the functionality that is activated, similar to the GstRtpSession element.

To use GstRtpBin as an RTP receiver, request a recv_rtp_sink_%u pad. The session number must be specified in the pad name. Data received on the recv_rtp_sink_%u pad will be processed in the GstRtpSession manager and after being validated forwarded on GstRtpSsrcDemux element. Each RTP stream is demuxed based on the SSRC and send to a GstRtpJitterBuffer. After the packets are released from the jitterbuffer, they will be forwarded to a GstRtpPtDemux element. The GstRtpPtDemux element will demux the packets based on the payload type and will create a unique pad recv_rtp_src_%u_%u_%u on rtpbin with the session number, SSRC and payload type respectively as the pad name.
To also use GstRtpBin as an RTCP receiver, request a recv_rtcp_sink_%u pad. The session number must be specified in the pad name.

If you want the session manager to generate and send RTCP packets, request the send_rtcp_src_%u pad with the session number in the pad name. Packet pushed on this pad contain SR/RR RTCP reports that should be sent to all participants in the session.

To use GstRtpBin as a sender, request a send_rtp_sink_%u pad, which will automatically create a send_rtp_src_%u pad. If the session number is not provided, the pad from the lowest available session will be returned. The session manager will modify the SSRC in the RTP packets to its own SSRC and wil forward the packets on the send_rtp_src_%u pad after updating its internal state.

GstRtpBin can also demultiplex incoming bundled streams. The first GstRtpSession will have a GstRtpSsrcDemux element splitting the streams based on their SSRC and potentially dispatched to a different GstRtpSession. Because retransmission SSRCs need to be merged with the corresponding media stream the âon-bundled-ssrcâ signal is emitted so that the application can find out to which session the SSRC belongs.

The session manager needs the clock-rate of the payload types it is handling and will signal the ârequest-pt-mapâ signal when it needs such a mapping. One can clear the cached values with the âclear-pt-mapâ signal.

Access to the internal statistics of rtpbin is provided with the get-internal-session property. This action signal gives access to the RTPSession object which further provides action signals to retrieve the internal source and other sources.

GstRtpBin also has signals (ârequest-rtp-encoderâ, ârequest-rtp-decoderâ, ârequest-rtcp-encoderâ and ârequest-rtp-decoderâ) to dynamically request for RTP and RTCP encoders and decoders in order to support SRTP. The encoders must provide the pads rtp_sink_%u and rtp_src_%u for RTP and rtcp_sink_%u and rtcp_src_%u for RTCP. The session number will be used in the pad name. The decoders must provide rtp_sink and rtp_src for RTP and rtcp_sink and rtcp_src for RTCP. The decoders will be placed before the GstRtpSession element, thus they must support SSRC demuxing internally.

GstRtpBin has signals (ârequest-aux-senderâ and ârequest-aux-receiverâ to dynamically request an element that can be used to create or merge additional RTP streams. AUX elements are needed to implement FEC or retransmission (such as RFC 4588). An AUX sender must have one sink_%u pad that matches the sessionid in the signal and it should have 1 or more src_%u pads. For each src_%\u pad, a session will be made (if needed) and the pad will be linked to the session send_rtp_sink pad. Each session will then expose its source pad as send_rtp_src_%u on GstRtpBin. An AUX receiver has 1 src_%u pad that much match the sessionid in the signal and 1 or more sink_%u pads. A session will be made for each sink_%u pad when the corresponding recv_rtp_sink_%u pad is requested on GstRtpBin.
refsect1.refsect2:
Example pipelines
gst-launch-1.0 udpsrc port=5000 caps="application/x-rtp, ..." ! .recv_rtp_sink_0 \ rtpbin ! rtptheoradepay ! theoradec ! xvimagesink Receive RTP data from port 5000 and send to the session 0 in rtpbin.
gst-launch-1.0 rtpbin name=rtpbin \ v4l2src ! videoconvert ! ffenc_h263 ! rtph263ppay ! rtpbin.send_rtp_sink_0 \ rtpbin.send_rtp_src_0 ! udpsink port=5000 \ rtpbin.send_rtcp_src_0 ! udpsink port=5001 sync=false async=false \ udpsrc port=5005 ! rtpbin.recv_rtcp_sink_0 \ audiotestsrc ! amrnbenc ! rtpamrpay ! rtpbin.send_rtp_sink_1 \ rtpbin.send_rtp_src_1 ! udpsink port=5002 \ rtpbin.send_rtcp_src_1 ! udpsink port=5003 sync=false async=false \ udpsrc port=5007 ! rtpbin.recv_rtcp_sink_1 Encode and payload H263 video captured from a v4l2src. Encode and payload AMR audio generated from audiotestsrc. The video is sent to session 0 in rtpbin and the audio is sent to session 1. Video packets are sent on UDP port 5000 and audio packets on port 5002. The video RTCP packets for session 0 are sent on port 5001 and the audio RTCP packets for session 0 are sent on port 5003. RTCP packets for session 0 are received on port 5005 and RTCP for session 1 is received on port 5007. Since RTCP packets from the sender should be sent as soon as possible and do not participate in preroll, sync=false and async=false is configured on udpsink
gst-launch-1.0 -v rtpbin name=rtpbin \ udpsrc caps="application/x-rtp,media=(string)video,clock-rate=(int)90000,encoding-name=(string)H263-1998" \ port=5000 ! rtpbin.recv_rtp_sink_0 \ rtpbin. ! rtph263pdepay ! ffdec_h263 ! xvimagesink \ udpsrc port=5001 ! rtpbin.recv_rtcp_sink_0 \ rtpbin.send_rtcp_src_0 ! udpsink port=5005 sync=false async=false \ udpsrc caps="application/x-rtp,media=(string)audio,clock-rate=(int)8000,encoding-name=(string)AMR,encoding-params=(string)1,octet-align=(string)1" \ port=5002 ! rtpbin.recv_rtp_sink_1 \ rtpbin. ! rtpamrdepay ! amrnbdec ! alsasink \ udpsrc port=5003 ! rtpbin.recv_rtcp_sink_1 \ rtpbin.send_rtcp_src_1 ! udpsink port=5007 sync=false async=false Receive H263 on port 5000, send it through rtpbin in session 0, depayload, decode and display the video. Receive AMR on port 5002, send it through rtpbin in session 1, depayload, decode and play the audio. Receive server RTCP packets for session 0 on port 5001 and RTCP packets for session 1 on port 5003. These packets will be used for session management and synchronisation. Send RTCP reports for session 0 on port 5005 and RTCP reports for session 1 on port 5007.

refsect2.title: struct GstRtpBin
refsect2.programlisting: struct GstRtpBin;

refsect2.title: The âdo-lostâ property
refsect2.programlisting: âdo-lostâ gboolean
refsect2.para: Send an event downstream when a packet is lost.

refsect2.title: The âlatencyâ property
refsect2.programlisting: âlatencyâ guint
refsect2.para: Default amount of ms to buffer in the jitterbuffers.

refsect2.title: The âsdesâ property
refsect2.programlisting: âsdesâ GstStructureÂ *
refsect2.para: The SDES items of this session.

refsect2.title: The âignore-ptâ property
refsect2.programlisting: âignore-ptâ gboolean
refsect2.para: Do not demultiplex based on PT values.

refsect2.title: The âautoremoveâ property
refsect2.programlisting: âautoremoveâ gboolean

refsect2.title: The âbuffer-modeâ property
refsect2.programlisting: âbuffer-modeâ RTPJitterBufferMode
refsect2.para: Control the buffering and timestamping mode used by the jitterbuffer.
Default value: Slave receiver to sender clock

refsect2.title: The ântp-syncâ property
refsect2.programlisting: ântp-syncâ gboolean
refsect2.para: Set the NTP time from the sender reports as the running-time on the buffers. When both the sender and receiver have sychronized running-time, i.e. when the clock and base-time is shared between the receivers and the and the senders, this option can be used to synchronize receivers on multiple machines.

refsect2.title: The âuse-pipeline-clockâ property
refsect2.programlisting: âuse-pipeline-clockâ gboolean
refsect2.para: Use the pipeline running-time to set the NTP time in the RTCP SR messages (DEPRECATED: Use ntp-time-source property).

refsect2.title: The ârtcp-syncâ property
refsect2.programlisting: ârtcp-syncâ GstRTCPSync
refsect2.para: If not synchronizing (directly) to the NTP clock, determines how to sync the various streams.

refsect2.title: The ârtcp-sync-intervalâ property
refsect2.programlisting: ârtcp-sync-intervalâ guint
refsect2.para: Determines how often to sync streams using RTCP data.

refsect2.title: The âdrop-on-latencyâ property
refsect2.programlisting: âdrop-on-latencyâ gboolean
refsect2.para: Tells the jitterbuffer to never exceed the given latency in size.

refsect2.title: The âdo-sync-eventâ property
refsect2.programlisting: âdo-sync-eventâ gboolean
refsect2.para: Send event downstream when a stream is synchronized to the sender.

refsect2.title: The âdo-retransmissionâ property
refsect2.programlisting: âdo-retransmissionâ gboolean
refsect2.para: Enables RTP retransmission on all streams. To control retransmission on a per-SSRC basis, connect to the ânew-jitterbufferâ signal and set the âdo-retransmissionâ property on the GstRtpJitterBuffer object instead.

refsect2.title: The ârtp-profileâ property
refsect2.programlisting: ârtp-profileâ GstRTPProfile
refsect2.para: Sets the default RTP profile of newly created RTP sessions. The profile can be changed afterwards on a per-session basis.

refsect2.title: The ântp-time-sourceâ property
refsect2.programlisting: ântp-time-sourceâ GstRtpNtpTimeSource
refsect2.para: NTP time source for RTCP packets.
Default value: NTP time based on realtime clock

refsect2.title: The âmax-dropout-timeâ property
refsect2.programlisting: âmax-dropout-timeâ guint
refsect2.para: The maximum time (milliseconds) of missing packets tolerated.

refsect2.title: The âmax-misorder-timeâ property
refsect2.programlisting: âmax-misorder-timeâ guint
refsect2.para: The maximum time (milliseconds) of misordered packets tolerated.

refsect2.title: The âmax-rtcp-rtp-time-diffâ property
refsect2.programlisting: âmax-rtcp-rtp-time-diffâ gint
refsect2.para: Maximum amount of time in ms that the RTP time in RTCP SRs is allowed to be ahead (-1 disabled).

refsect2.title: The ârtcp-sync-send-timeâ property
refsect2.programlisting: ârtcp-sync-send-timeâ gboolean
refsect2.para: Use send time or capture time for RTCP sync (TRUE = send time, FALSE = capture time).

refsect2.title: The ârfc7273-syncâ property
refsect2.programlisting: ârfc7273-syncâ gboolean
refsect2.para: Synchronize received streams to the RFC7273 clock (requires clock and offset to be provided).

refsect2.title: The âmax-streamsâ property
refsect2.programlisting: âmax-streamsâ guint
refsect2.para: The maximum number of streams to create for one session.

refsect2.title: The âclear-pt-mapâ signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GstRtpBin *rtpbin, gpointer user_data)
refsect2.para: Clear all previously cached pt-mapping obtained with ârequest-pt-mapâ.

entry.para: the object which received the signal

entry.simpara: user_data
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The âget-internal-sessionâ signal
refsect2.programlisting: RTPSession* user_function (GstRtpBin *rtpbin, guint id, gpointer user_data)
refsect2.para: Request the internal RTPSession object as GObject in session id .

entry.para: the object which received the signal

entry.simpara: user_data
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The âon-bye-ssrcâ signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GstRtpBin *rtpbin, guint session, guint ssrc, gpointer user_data)
refsect2.para: Notify of an SSRC that became inactive because of a BYE packet.

entry.para: the object which received the signal

entry.simpara: user_data
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The âon-bye-timeoutâ signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GstRtpBin *rtpbin, guint session, guint ssrc, gpointer user_data)
refsect2.para: Notify of an SSRC that has timed out because of BYE

entry.para: the object which received the signal

entry.simpara: user_data
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The âon-new-ssrcâ signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GstRtpBin *rtpbin, guint session, guint ssrc, gpointer user_data)
refsect2.para: Notify of a new SSRC that entered session .

entry.para: the object which received the signal

entry.simpara: user_data
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The âon-npt-stopâ signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GstRtpBin *rtpbin, guint session, guint ssrc, gpointer user_data)
refsect2.para: Notify that SSRC sender has sent data up to the configured NPT stop time.

entry.para: the object which received the signal

entry.simpara: user_data
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The âon-sender-timeoutâ signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GstRtpBin *rtpbin, guint session, guint ssrc, gpointer user_data)
refsect2.para: Notify of a sender SSRC that has timed out and became a receiver

entry.para: the object which received the signal

entry.simpara: user_data
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The âon-ssrc-activeâ signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GstRtpBin *rtpbin, guint session, guint ssrc, gpointer user_data)
refsect2.para: Notify of a SSRC that is active, i.e., sending RTCP.

entry.para: the object which received the signal

entry.simpara: user_data
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The âon-ssrc-collisionâ signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GstRtpBin *rtpbin, guint session, guint ssrc, gpointer user_data)
refsect2.para: Notify when we have an SSRC collision

entry.para: the object which received the signal

entry.simpara: user_data
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The âon-ssrc-sdesâ signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GstRtpBin *rtpbin, guint session, guint ssrc, gpointer user_data)
refsect2.para: Notify of a SSRC that is active, i.e., sending RTCP.

entry.para: the object which received the signal

entry.simpara: user_data
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The âon-ssrc-validatedâ signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GstRtpBin *rtpbin, guint session, guint ssrc, gpointer user_data)
refsect2.para: Notify of a new SSRC that became validated.

entry.para: the object which received the signal

entry.simpara: user_data
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The âon-timeoutâ signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GstRtpBin *rtpbin, guint session, guint ssrc, gpointer user_data)
refsect2.para: Notify of an SSRC that has timed out

entry.para: the object which received the signal

entry.simpara: user_data
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The ârequest-pt-mapâ signal
refsect2.programlisting: GstCaps* user_function (GstRtpBin *rtpbin, guint session, guint pt, gpointer user_data)
refsect2.para: Request the payload type as GstCaps for pt in session .

entry.para: the object which received the signal

entry.simpara: user_data
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The âreset-syncâ signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GstRtpBin *rtpbin, gpointer user_data)
refsect2.para: Reset all currently configured lip-sync parameters and require new SR packets for all streams before lip-sync is attempted again.

entry.para: the object which received the signal

entry.simpara: user_data
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The âpayload-type-changeâ signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GstRtpBin *rtpbin, guint session, guint pt, gpointer user_data)
refsect2.para: Signal that the current payload type changed to pt in session .

entry.para: the object which received the signal

entry.simpara: user_data
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The ânew-jitterbufferâ signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GstRtpBin *rtpbin, GstElement *jitterbuffer, guint session, guint ssrc, gpointer user_data)
refsect2.para: Notify that a new jitterbuffer was created for session and ssrc . This signal can, for example, be used to configure jitterbuffer .

entry.para: the object which received the signal

entry.simpara: user_data
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The ârequest-aux-receiverâ signal
refsect2.programlisting: GstElement* user_function (GstRtpBin *rtpbin, guint session, gpointer user_data)
refsect2.para: Request an AUX receiver element for the given session . The AUX element will be added to the bin.
If no handler is connected, no AUX element will be used.

entry.para: the object which received the signal

entry.simpara: user_data
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The ârequest-aux-senderâ signal
refsect2.programlisting: GstElement* user_function (GstRtpBin *rtpbin, guint session, gpointer user_data)
refsect2.para: Request an AUX sender element for the given session . The AUX element will be added to the bin.
If no handler is connected, no AUX element will be used.

entry.para: the object which received the signal

entry.simpara: user_data
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The ârequest-rtcp-decoderâ signal
refsect2.programlisting: GstElement* user_function (GstRtpBin *rtpbin, guint session, gpointer user_data)
refsect2.para: Request an RTCP decoder element for the given session . The decoder element will be added to the bin if not previously added.
If no handler is connected, no encoder will be used.

entry.para: the object which received the signal

entry.simpara: user_data
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The ârequest-rtcp-encoderâ signal
refsect2.programlisting: GstElement* user_function (GstRtpBin *rtpbin, guint session, gpointer user_data)
refsect2.para: Request an RTCP encoder element for the given session . The encoder element will be added to the bin if not previously added.
If no handler is connected, no encoder will be used.

entry.para: the object which received the signal

entry.simpara: user_data
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The ârequest-rtp-decoderâ signal
refsect2.programlisting: GstElement* user_function (GstRtpBin *rtpbin, guint session, gpointer user_data)
refsect2.para: Request an RTP decoder element for the given session . The decoder element will be added to the bin if not previously added.
If no handler is connected, no encoder will be used.

entry.para: the object which received the signal

entry.simpara: user_data
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The ârequest-rtp-encoderâ signal
refsect2.programlisting: GstElement* user_function (GstRtpBin *rtpbin, guint session, gpointer user_data)
refsect2.para: Request an RTP encoder element for the given session . The encoder element will be added to the bin if not previously added.
If no handler is connected, no encoder will be used.

entry.para: the object which received the signal

entry.simpara: user_data
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The âon-new-sender-ssrcâ signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GstRtpBin *rtpbin, guint session, guint ssrc, gpointer user_data)
refsect2.para: Notify of a new sender SSRC that entered session .

entry.para: the object which received the signal

entry.simpara: user_data
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The âon-sender-ssrc-activeâ signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GstRtpBin *rtpbin, guint session, guint ssrc, gpointer user_data)
refsect2.para: Notify of a sender SSRC that is active, i.e., sending RTCP.

entry.para: the object which received the signal

entry.simpara: user_data
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The âget-sessionâ signal
refsect2.programlisting: GstElement* user_function (GstRtpBin *rtpbin, guint id, gpointer user_data)
refsect2.para: Request the related GstRtpSession as GstElement related with session id .

entry.para: the object which received the signal

entry.simpara: user_data
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The âon-bundled-ssrcâ signal
refsect2.programlisting: guint user_function (GstRtpBin *rtpbin, guint ssrc, gpointer user_data)
refsect2.para: Notify of a new incoming bundled SSRC. If no handler is connected to the signal then the GstRtpSession created for the recv_rtp_sink_%u request pad will be managing this new SSRC. However if there is a handler connected then the application can decided to dispatch this new stream to another session by providing its ID as return value of the handler. This can be particularly useful to keep retransmission SSRCs grouped with the session for which they handle retransmission.

entry.para: the object which received the signal

entry.simpara: user_data
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
